text: Are you looking for a college that offers future-focused degree programs, flexible learning options, small class sizes, and over-the-top student support, all on a beautiful and safe campus?  Then put the University of Arkansas - Fort Smith at the top of your list.
UAFS offers an education focused on your future, and many of our programs lead to 100 percent placement of graduates in meaningful careers or prestigious graduate schools.
Over 80 future-focused bachelor's and associate degrees and certificates
Low 18 to 1 student to professor ratio
Flexible learning options including online and evening courses
One of the most affordable universities in the region
96 percent of UAFS students received more than $54 million in federal, state and institutional financial aid and scholarships last year.
Convenient suite-style and apartment on-campus living
Fill out the form below to get in touch with an admissions officer.
Select which student category best fits you.

Submit the following to the Office of Admissions:
An official high school transcript or satisfactory completion of the General Education Development (GED) test.
Official college transcripts from any other colleges/universities attended.
Proof of immunization against measles, mumps, and rubella. Immunity can be shown by providing proof of having received two doses of measles, two doses of mumps, and two doses of rubella vaccine.
Official ACT or SAT scores. Test scores are current for four years.
